intro: Leiboldia guerreroana, commonly known as the Guerrero orchid, is a rare flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Central America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers with intricate patterns. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, thriving in the understory of dense tropical forests. Its roots are adapted to absorb nutrients from the rich, organic soil of its habitat. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
